definition[0]: if liquid trickles somewhere, it flows slowly in drops or in a thin stream
example[0]: The tears trickled down her cheeks.
definition[1]: if people, vehicles, goods etc trickle somewhere, they move there slowly in small groups or amounts
example[1]: The first few fans started to trickle into the stadium.
definition[2]: a thin slow flow of liquid
example[2]: The water in the stream had been reduced to a trickle.
definition[3]: a movement of people, vehicles, goods etc into a place in very small numbers or amounts
example[3]: Recent legislation has reduced immigration to a trickle.
example[4]: a trickle of cars on the highway
definition[4]: to move somewhere slowly and in very small numbers or amounts
example[5]: Only four or five customers had trickled in by 11:30.
example[6]: Details of the programs have trickled out over the past weeks, but havenâ€™t been widely publicized.
